data.title: 'Grey's Anatomy' fans may not have seen the last of Ellen Pompeo as Meredith Grey — here's what we know about her possible return
data.meta_description: Ellen Pompeo is no longer a series regular on "Grey's Anatomy," but in a discussion for Variety, she said it's "not a complete goodbye."
data.text:
"I will be making some appearances hopefully next year, if I can find some time," Pompeo told Heigl. "No, it's not a complete goodbye. And I think we've got an interesting story to tell."

When was Ellen Pompeo's last 'Grey's Anatomy' episode?

Pompeo bid farewell to fans in a November 2022 Instagram post, a few months before her final episode as a series regular actually aired in February.

"I am eternally grateful and humbled by the love and support you have all shown me, Meredith GREY and the show for 19 seasons!" she wrote. "Through it all….none of it …would have been possible without the best fans in the world. You all are RIDERS and you all have made the ride so fun and ICONIC!!"

Related stories

In that post, Pompeo also teased that she would "definitely be back to visit."

As Insider's Esme Mazzeo previously reported, Meredith Grey officially left Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital in Seattle to do Alzheimer's research at the Catherine Fox Foundation in Boston in the February 23, 2023 episode titled "I'll Follow the Sun." It marked Pompeo's final appearance as a series regular.

Pompeo made one more appearance after that, in the May 18 season 19 finale, when several of the doctors went to Boston. And now, it sounds like there could be more to come in season 20 or beyond, if the history-making ABC hit keeps chugging along.

Pompeo, who has starred in the medical drama since its first season, remains an executive producer on the series. Variety reported that would be the case when it broke the news in August 2022 that Pompeo would take a reduced on-screen role on the medical drama, only appearing in eight episodes of "Grey's Anatomy" season 19.

As Pompeo and Heigl discussed in their recent conversation, Pompeo is stepping away in part to star in a new Hulu show, tentatively titled "The Orphan," which is set to start production in September. The limited series will tell the story of Natalia Grace, a Ukrainian orphan whose adoptive parents claim she's actually an adult con artist.
